title: The Strength of Perseverance and the Aesthetics of Incompletion

body.v: Strength is the will to keep moving forward without giving up, even while carrying the weight of past injustices and failures.
Here, 'strength' does not refer to physical power or endurance, but to the courage to flee, to choose again, and to start over as many times as necessary.

Despite repeated setbacks such as failing high school entrance exams, withdrawal, depression, and social eating phobia, one can still step out again, relearn, build a career in a major company, and restore family life.
A dining table swarmed with fruit flies symbolizes oppression, while a clean table represents freedom and love earned through oneâ€™s own effort.
Past failures and hardships may simply signify personal limits, and repeated burdens can be seen as obstructing growth rather than nurturing it.
